thing-type.label: FGS214 Single Switch 1x1.5KW
thing-type.description: Single Switch 1x1.5KW<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe remotely operated FIBARO Smart Module and Double Smart Module are designed to turn electrical devices or circuits on and off. Smart Module allows to control one device or circuit. The compact size of the device allows for the product to be installed in the housings of other devices. The devices can be controlled either via the Z-Wave™ network or with buttons connected directly to them.<br /&gt<br /&gtMain features:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtWorks with various types of switches and buttons.</li&gt <li&gtSupports Z-Wave network Security Modes: S0 with AES-128 en-cryption and S2 Authenticated with PRNG-based encryption.</li&gt <li&gtWorks as a Z-Wave signal repeater (all non-battery operated de-vices within the network will act as repeaters to increase reliabili-ty of the network).</li&gt <li&gtMay be used with all devices certified with the Z-Wave Plus™ certificate and should be compatible with such devices produced by other manufacturers.</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gtThe device is a Security Enabled Z-Wave Plus product and a Security Enabled Z-Wave Controller must be used in order to fully utilize the product.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtFibaro Switch must be placed within the range of Home Center<br /&gtcontroller, as adding mode requires direct communication with the<br /&gtcontroller.<br /&gt<br /&gtFind key no. 1 which allows to switch circuit 1 on, in accordance<br /&gtwith the diagram<br /&gtDuring the installation it is recommended to use a<br /&gtmomentary key connected to S1.<br /&gt<br /&gtAdd Fibaro Switch to the network by pushing three times key no. 1<br /&gtor push-button B located inside the housing of the device. For<br /&gttoggle switch perform 3 position changes.<br /&gt<br /&gtThe controller indicates when the device is correctly added to the<br /&gtnetwork.<br /&gt<br /&gt<strong&gtCAUTION</strong&gt<br /&gtFibaro Switch cancels the "learning" mode after<br /&gtkey no. 1 is pressed once. Therefore, pressing key<br /&gtno. 1 four times will not add the devices to the<br /&gtnetwork. The same applies to push-button B.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtFind key no. 1 which allows to switch circuit 1 on, in accordance<br /&gtwith the diagram<br /&gtDuring removing it is recommended to use a<br /&gtmomentary key connected to S1.<br /&gt<br /&gtRemove Fibaro Switch from the network by pushing three times key no. 1<br /&gtor push-button B located inside the housing of the device. For<br /&gttoggle switch perform 3 position changes.<br /&gt<br /&gtThe controller indicates when the device is correctly removed from the<br /&gtnetwork.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtMains powered device.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Remember relays state
parameter.description: Determines the state of relays after power supply failure (e.g. power outage).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 – relays remain switched off after restoring power<br /&gt1 – restore remembered state of relays after restoring power<br /&gt2 – restore remembered state of relays after restoring power, but for toggle switches (parameter 20/21 set to 1) set the same state as the current state of the switches</p&gt <p&gtFor auto OFF and flashing modes the parameter is not relevant and the relay will always remain switched off.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: state of relays after restoring power
Restore state after restoring power see overview

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: S1 input – switch type
parameter.description: Type of the device connected to the S1 terminal.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 – momentary switch<br /&gt1 – toggle switch synchronized (contact closed - ON, contact opened - OFF) <br /&gt2 – toggle switch with memory (device changes status when switch changes status)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_21_1
parameter.label: 21: S2 input – switch type
parameter.description: Type of the device connected to the S2 terminal.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 – momentary switch<br /&gt1 – toggle switch synchronized (contact closed - ON, contact opened - OFF) <br /&gt2 – toggle switch with memory (device changes status when switch changes status)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_1
parameter.label: 24: Inputs orientation
parameter.description: Reversing operation of S1 and S2 inputs.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows reversing operation of S1 and S2 inputs without changing the wiring. Use in case of incorrect wiring.</p&gt <p&gt0 – default (S1 - 1st channel, S2 - 2nd channel)<br /&gt1 – reversed (S1 - 2nd channel, S2 - 1st channel)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 30: Alarm configuration 1 Action Type
parameter.description: which alarm frames and how the device should react<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gtDefault Value [0x05, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00] (Water Alarm, any notification, no action)</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action: 0x00 – no action, 0x01 – turn ON, 0x02 – turn OFF, 0x03 – turn ON/OFF continuously</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_4_0000FF00
parameter.label: 30: Alarm configuration 1 Event/State
parameter.description: Event/State Parameters

parameter.name: config_30_4_00FF0000
parameter.label: 30: Alarm configuration - 1st slot - Notify Status
parameter.description: Notification Status

parameter.name: config_30_4_7F000000
parameter.label: 30: Alarm configuration - 1st slot - Notify Type
parameter.description: Notification Type

parameter.name: config_31_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 31: Alarm configuration - 2nd slot
parameter.description: Water Alarm<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gtDefault Value [0x05, 0xFF, 0x00, 0x00] (Water Alarm, any notification, no action)</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action: 0x00 – no action, 0x01 – turn ON, 0x02 – turn OFF, 0x03 – turn ON/OFF continuously</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_32_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 32: Alarm configuration - 3rd slot - Smoke Alarm
parameter.description: Action<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action: 0x00 – no action, 0x01 – turn ON, 0x02 – turn OFF, 0x03 – turn ON/OFF continuously</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.description: Notification Status

parameter.description: Notification Type

parameter.name: config_33_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 33: Alarm configuration - 4th slot - CO Alarm
parameter.description: Action<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action: 0x00 – no action, 0x01 – turn ON, 0x02 – turn OFF, 0x03 – turn ON/OFF continuously</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 33: Alarm configuration - 4th slot - CO Alarm

parameter.description: Notification Status

parameter.label: 33: Alarm configuration - 4th slot - CO Alarm
parameter.description: Notification Type

parameter.name: config_34_4_000000FF
parameter.label: 34: Alarm configuration - 5th slot
parameter.description: Heat Alarm<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines to which alarm frames and how the device should react. The parameters consist of 4 bytes, three most significant bytes are set according to the official Z-Wave protocol specification.</p&gt <p&gt1B [MSB] – Notification Type</p&gt <p&gt2B – Notification Status</p&gt <p&gt3B – Event/State Parameters</p&gt <p&gt4B [LSB] – action: 0x00 – no action, 0x01 – turn ON, 0x02 – turn OFF, 0x03 – turn ON/OFF continuously</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 34: Alarm configuration - 5th slot
parameter.description: Notification Type

parameter.name: config_35_2
parameter.label: 35: Alarm configuration – duration
parameter.description: Duration of alarm se-quence<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines duration of alarm se-quence. When time set in this parameter elaps-es, alarm is cancelled and relays restore normal operation, but do not recover state from before the alarm.<br /&gt0 – infinite<br /&gt1-32400 (1s-9h, 1s step) – duration</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: S1 input – scenes sent
parameter.description: Actions result in sending scene IDs<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent).<br /&gt<br /&gtEnabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learning mode by triple clicking.<br /&gt<br /&gt0 – no scenes sent<br /&gt1 – Key pressed 1 time<br /&gt2 – Key pressed 2 times<br /&gt4 – Key pressed 3 times<br /&gt8 – Key hold down and key released</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_41_1
parameter.label: 41: S2 input – scenes sent
parameter.description: Actions result in sending scene IDs<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines which actions result in sending scene IDs assigned to them. Values can be combined (e.g. 1+2=3 means that scenes for single and double click are sent).<br /&gt<br /&gtEnabling scenes for triple click disables entering the device in learning mode by triple clicking.<br /&gt<br /&gt0 – no scenes sent<br /&gt1 – Key pressed 1 time<br /&gt2 – Key pressed 2 times<br /&gt4 – Key pressed 3 times<br /&gt8 – Key hold down and key released</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_150_1
parameter.label: 150: Operating mode
parameter.description: Operating mode for channel controlled with Q output.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to choose operating mode for channel controlled with Q/Q1 output. For timed modes (value 1, 2 or 3), time is set with parameter 154 and reaction to input change is set with parameter 152.<br /&gt<br /&gt0 – standard operation<br /&gt1 – delayed OFF<br /&gt2 – auto OFF<br /&gt3 – flashing</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_152_1
parameter.label: 152: Reaction to input change in delayed/auto OFF modes
parameter.description: Reaction when changing state of S1 input in timed modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter determines how the device reacts when changing state of S1 input in timed modes for first channel.<br /&gt<br /&gt0 – cancel mode and set default state<br /&gt1 – no reaction, mode runs until it ends<br /&gt2 – reset timer, start counting time from the beginning</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: cancel mode and set default state
no reaction, mode runs until it ends

parameter.name: config_154_2
parameter.label: 154: Time for delayed/auto OFF and flashing modes
parameter.description: Sets time parameter used in timed modes.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter allows to set time parameter used in timed modes for first channel. For de-layed/auto OFF modes it determines duration, for flashing mode it determines cycle period.<br /&gt<br /&gt0 – 0.1 seconds<br /&gt1-32000 – 0.1-3200 seconds, 0.1s step</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_156_2
parameter.label: 156: S1: Switch ON sent to 2nd association group
parameter.description: S1 input – Switch ON value sent to 2nd association group<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Switch ON command to devices in 2nd association group when using S1 input.<br /&gt<br /&gt0 – turn off<br /&gt1-99 – turn on and set level<br /&gt255 – turn on with last level</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_157_2
parameter.label: 157: S1: Switch OFF sent to 2nd association group
parameter.description: S1 input – Switch OFF value sent to 2nd association group<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Switch OFF command to devices in 2nd association group when using S1 input.<br /&gt<br /&gt0 – turn off<br /&gt1-99 – turn on and set level<br /&gt255 – turn on with last level</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_158_2
parameter.label: 158: S1: Double Click sent to 2nd association group
parameter.description: S1 input – Double Click value sent to 2nd association group<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines value sent with Double Click command to devices in 2nd association group when using S1 input.<br /&gt<br /&gt0 – turn off<br /&gt1-99 – turn on and set level<br /&gt255 – turn on with last level</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_162_1
parameter.label: 162: Q/Q1 output type
parameter.description: This parameter determines type of Q/Q1 output.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gt0 – Normally Open (relay contacts opened turned off, closed when turned on)<br /&gt1 – Normally Closed (relay contacts closed turned off, opened when turned on)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_1
parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
parameter.description: Device status and al-lows for assigning single device only<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt1st association group – “Lifeline” reports the device status and al-lows for assigning single device only (main controller by default).</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: On/Off
parameter.description: Turn the associated devices on/off<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt2nd association group – “On/Off” is used to turn the associated devices on/off reflecting input operation (uses Basic command class).</p&gt
